page.description: Creating, using, editing, renaming, and copying a named datasource.

section.title: Create a Named DataSource
section.description: To create a named data source:

step.description: Create an ad hoc data source.
In the Specify DataSource dialog click Save as named datasource.
Enter a name in the Save DataSource dialog and click OK.

section.title: Use a Named DataSource
section.description: If you have already created one or more named data sources:

step.description: Select the Use named DataSource radio button.
Click OK.
Continue with Design-Time Properties.

section.title: Edit a Named DataSource
section.description: To modify a named data source:

step.description: Display the Reports tab of the Control Panel.
Click New to display the New Report dialog.
Select "" and click OK to display the Specify DataSource dialog.
Choose the data source from the Select Named DataSource list and click Edit.

section.title: Rename a Named DataSource
section.description: To modify a named data source:

step.description: Display the Reports tab of the Control Panel.
Click New to display the New Report dialog.
Select "" and click OK to display the Specify DataSource dialog.
Choose the data source from the Select Named DataSource list and click Rename.
Enter the new name and click OK.

section.title: Copy a Named DataSource
section.description: To modify a named data source:

step.description: Display the Reports tab of the Control Panel.
Click New to display the New Report dialog.
Select "" and click OK to display the Specify DataSource dialog.
Choose the data source from the Select Named DataSource list and click Save As.
Enter the new name and click OK.
